qas.question: When was the United Grand Lodge of England Formed?
The Grand Orient de France and the United Grand Lodge of England continued in amity until when?
What year did the Supreme Council of the Ancient and Accepted Scottish Rite of Louisiana appear in the jurisdiction of the Grand Lodge of Louisiana?
When was the United Grand Lodge of England demolished?
What year did the Supreme Council of the Ancient and Accepted Scottish Rite of Louisiana disappear in the jurisdiction of the Grand Lodge of Louisiana?
What lodge was never in amity with another?
Who did the new Scottish rite body refuse to admit?

context: The ritual form on which the Grand Orient of France was based was abolished in England in the events leading to the formation of the <b5_0>United Grand Lodge of England<b5_0/> in <a0_0><b3_0>1813<b3_0/><a0_0/>. However the two jurisdictions continued in amity (mutual recognition) until events of <a1_0>the 1860s and 1870s<a1_0/> drove a seemingly permanent wedge between them. In <a2_0><b4_0>1868<b4_0/><a2_0/> the Supreme Council of the Ancient and Accepted Scottish Rite of the State of Louisiana appeared in the jurisdiction of the Grand Lodge of Louisiana, recognised by the Grand Orient de France, but regarded by the older body as an invasion of their jurisdiction. The new Scottish rite body admitted <b6_0>blacks<b6_0/>, and the resolution of the Grand Orient the following year that neither colour, race, nor religion could disqualify a man from Masonry prompted the Grand Lodge to withdraw recognition, and it persuaded other American Grand Lodges to do the same.
